meta.article_title: November 2, 2015 - Distance from Table When Looping a Push

terminologie_extrait.definition: The act of rotating the body to generate power and speed in a shot.
terminologie_extrait.contexte: Used when looping backspin or topspin.

distance-from-table-when-looping-a-push.probleme: Standing too far from the table when looping against backspin.
distance-from-table-when-looping-a-push.diagnostic: Players backing up or using a soft loop with mostly upward motion.

debutant.description: Learn to jam the table with your left leg (for righties) when looping backspin.

intermediaire.description: Use body torque to generate power and speed in a shot.

exercices_complementaires.nom: Jamming the table with your left leg
exercices_complementaires.description: Contact the ball to the side of your body instead of in front.

metriques_progression.target: 50-50 speed and spin ratio on most shots
